SR - Batch-mode Search and Replace

Usage:
sr pattern replace files path > sr.log
Parameters:
pattern - search pattern ("^\\s*$"). See QRegExp for details on constructing a regular expression.
replace - replace string ("Replace with this"). The string that replaces the matched text in the file. Default: "".
files - wildcard file expression("*.cpp *.h"). Default: all files.
path - the starting directory (C:/Qt/examples). Default: current directory.
Notes:
  1. If no arguments. Returns a help string.
  2. Declare one, and only one, instance of AG named gGbl for each application.
  3. Replace defaults to an empty string, in which case the matched strings are deleted.
  4. Path defaults to the current working directory.
  5. Include only text files in file argument such as *.txt, *.log, *.html, *.ini, *.h, *.c, *.cpp, etc.
  6. Files defaults to all files *.*.
  7. Generated messages may not show up in debugger even with endl. Run outside debugger or use qdebug.
  8. On the command line, redirect stdout to a file in order to capture all generated messages in a file (see example below).
See also:
AGsr - for more details 
Example with 5 args:
	sr "^\\s*$" "# empty" "." "*.txt" > sr.log
